intro: Cakile perfoliata, commonly known as the American bladderwrack, is a flowering plant native to the United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of fleshy, thick leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Cakile perfoliata is adapted to grow in rocky and coastal environments, where it can tolerate saline and nutrient-poor soils.
